'Bdelloidea' () is a class of rotifers found in fresh water and moist soil.
Bdelloids typically have a well-developed corona, divided into two parts, on a
retractable head. They may move by swimming or crawling. The latter commonly
involves taking alternate steps with the head and tail, as do certain leeches,
which gives the group their name (Greek Î²Î´ÎµÎ»Î»Î± or bdella, meaning leech).
